newsitem.title: CANADA: Canadian spot natgas prices steady in quiet trade.
newsitem.headline: Canadian spot natgas prices steady in quiet trade.

text.p: Canadian spot natural gas prices on Monday held steady from last week in trade kept mostly quiet by the U.S. Memorial Day holiday, traders said.

Spot gas at the AECO storage hub in Alberta was quoted at C$1.69 per gigajoule, up about two cents from Friday, but down three cents from deals done over the weekend. June AECO was discussed at C$1.70 per GJ, unchanged from Friday.

NOVA Gas Transmission was cutting transport on its Edson mainline in northwestern Alberta by a total of 200 million cubic feet per day in preperation for scheduled maintenenace set to start on Tuesday, a NGTL spokesman said.

But a Calgary-based marketer said the cut would have little price impact because maintenance was already being done at the Alberta-British Columbia border point in the southwest and McNiell into the Foothills pipeline in the southeast.
The ABC and McNiell maintenance had been backing interruptible gas volumes into Alberta.
"That makes it a non-event," the marketer said.

At the borders, gas at Niagara was pegged at US$2.45/2.50 per million British thermal units, based on where the market and NYMEX futures prices settled on Friday, a trader of eastern Canadian gas said.
That would be up about five cents over the weekend, although no spot trades were reported early on Monday.
In the west, gas for export at Sumas, Washington was talked at about US$1.35 per mmBtu, about on par with Friday. ((Reuters Calgary Bureau (403) 531-1624))
